acknowledgments.summary: The VAPT Team, C3i Center, IITK, UP, India, reported to CISA that they had coordinated these vulnerabilities directly with SSS.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to read sensitive information, execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service condition.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE SECTORS: Energy, Transportation Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-20-042-01 - Web Scraped Version

document.title: Synergy Systems & Solutions HUSKY RTU (Update A)

notes.text: The affected product does not require adequate authentication, which may allow an attacker to read sensitive information or execute arbitrary code.CVE-2019-20046 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: SSS makes the following recommendations to mitigate risk.
For more information, see the associated SSS security bulletin.

notes.text: Specially crafted malicious packets could cause disconnection of active authentic connections or reboot of device. CVE-2019-20045 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).. --------- Begin Update A Part 2 of 3 ---------CVE-2019-20045 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: SSS makes the following recommendations to mitigate risk.
For more information, see the associated SSS security bulletin.

notes.text: The affected product does not require authentication for TELNET access, which may allow an attacker to change configuration or perform other malicious activities.CVE-2019-16879 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: SSS makes the following recommendations to mitigate risk.
For more information, see the associated SSS security bulletin.

cwe.name: Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions

notes.text: The affected product is vulnerable to specially crafted TCP packets, which can cause the device to shut down or reboot and lose configuration settings.CVE-2020-7800 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: SSS makes the following recommendations to mitigate risk.
For more information, see the associated SSS security bulletin.

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: The affected product is vulnerable to information exposure over the SNMP protocol.CVE-2020-7801 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: SSS makes the following recommendations to mitigate risk.
For more information, see the associated SSS security bulletin.

notes.text: The affected product is vulnerable to insufficient default permissions, which could allow an attacker to view network configurations through SNMP communication. CVE-2020-7802 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:H/A:N).. --------- End Update A Part 2 of 3 ---------CVE-2020-7802 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: SSS makes the following recommendations to mitigate risk.
For more information, see the associated SSS security bulletin.
